intro: Jambosa glabrata, commonly known as the smooth jambosa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture. Its fruit is a large, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds. Jambosa glabrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral displays.
